lose_facts.info: I know what you're thinking… “OMG I dont litter! I love the ocean!” But out of everything we throw away, less than 10% is actually recycled, and about 80% ends up in either landfills or the ocean!
Every minute, the equivalent of one truckload of trash enters the world’s oceans.
Swim for your life! There’s currently 363,762,732,605 pounds of TRASH in the world’s oceans.
If we continue at our current rate of consumption, by 2050 there will be more trash in the ocean than fish.
As time passes, trash breaks down into smaller pieces and microplastics, which contaminates ecosystems and is directly responsible for killing over a MILLION marine animals every year.

Unfortunately, microplastics have already spread across the globe as they’ve been documented everywhere from samples of Arctic Sea ice, to the top of Mount Everest.  A clear plastic produce bag holds the record for deepest piece of plastic, as it currently sits at the bottom of the Mariana Trench, 36,000 feet below sea level.
About 100 million marine animals die each year just from plastic waste!
